author: protolambda
content:
Implemented the proposed changes by <@!425567222635954178> , with some additions/imporovements here and there: https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/pull/2455
- It's small reduction in line count
- It addresses some related issues (non-committees for shard/slot combinations)
- It makes merkle-proofs to confirmation data very direct (since the union selector asserts that it's confirmed)
- It unifies the pending and grandparent structures
- It reduces state-size (lists instead of vectors, just capture active shards)
- It looks more like a state-machine thanks to the union-selector.

author: protolambda
content: One thing though: how should slow confirmation of shard data work? I.e. if there is no `2/3` majority of the committee voting for the shard header? Previously it would mark the shard-data with the most votes as confirmed, but I'm uncertain if that's right. I can re-introduce that easily if necessary.
